question: CT thorax represents:-
exp: * In the given image we could see the intimal flap creating 2 lumens- Small and contrast opacifying - true lumen- Large and less contrast - false lumen* AAD is more dangerous as they involve Aoic root, coronary vessels and can also cause cardiac tamponade. Hence surgical management is done for these cases.

question: New born male baby presented with congestive hea failure. On examination enlarged fontanelles, a loud cranial bruit and following radiological finding was noted the mostly likely diagnosis:-
exp: * The given image shows large midline cystic swelling and hydrocephalus in the baby* With the given information (large midline cystic swelling; hydrocephalus; congestive hea failure) it is clear that the given case is Vein of Galen malformation* Vein of Galen malformation is a misnomer as it is an AV malformation* Vein of Galen malformation is any malformation occurring at the level of great cerebral vein that causes midline cystic swelling * This large midline cystic swelling compresses the flow of CSF leading to Hydrocephalus and congestive hea failure
